summary: The Rio San José and Rio Jemez Water Settlements Act of 2025 aims to settle water rights claims of the Pueblos of Acoma, Laguna, Jemez, and Zia in New Mexico. It approves water rights agreements, establishes trust funds for water infrastructure, and outlines waivers and releases of claims. The bill details funding amounts, sets an Enforceability Date contingent on various conditions being met, and addresses environmental compliance. It also includes provisions for the administration and use of water rights and clarifies the authority of the Secretary of the Interior.
